Murray"}]}],"comment":[],"tag":[]}, {"id":"OD-39","entityId":"2-162","jiraId":null,"field":[{"name":"projectShortName","value":"OD"},{"name":"summary","value":"Image import api"},{"name":"reporterFullName","value":"Garth Murray"},{"name":"created","value":"1585061656228"},{"name":"numberInProject","value":"39"},{"name":"description","value":"

Integrate Chris's image api to submit images to Xact

A RESTful API to send requests for images to be transferred from S3 to Xact:

TEST: POST https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemandTEST/assignments/{transactionId}/attachments
LIVE: POST https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemand/assignments/{transactionId}/attachments

Where {transactionId} is the transactionId of the assignment in Xact you want to send attachments to, e.g.:
TEST https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemandTEST/assignments/006TVSS/attachments
LIVE https://api.grsclaims.com/ondemand/assignments/03YRN18/attachments

The Content-Type should be "application/json" and you need to include the API key 4iiAo9qVpD60FD7dGGfeC14OV7fNkrLp8VvWkb5S in an "x-api-key" header.

The JSON to post should follow the format below, which is basically an array of attachment objects:

[ { "id": 1234, "key": "6/photos/ycnYxyd7q5BVcXIfBDLMdAjAQNihjUpj36yCUSvC.jpeg", "filename": "house.png", "description": "testing", "datetime": "2020-03-18T18:25:31Z" }, { "id": 2345, "key": "6/photos/0nJERpPiCSEmw1MUuCQ48WiKOSHl32PAbPplEjqh.jpeg", "filename": "flashing.jpeg", "datetime": "2020-03-18T16:23:52Z" }, { "id": 2, "key": "6/photos/r0y4MXIaFh0ysZRjpLE1KCoO3UiWVgBI4SX1nYZc.jpeg", "datetime": "2020-03-18T16:23:52Z" } ]
All of the attachment properties are optional apart from the "key" (which represents the key within the S3 grsondemandapp bucket), with the other values being assigned defaults based on the "key" or current date or position within the array as necessary. So, this is also a valid request:

[ { "key": "19/photos/5yVxwV06sZDSmseu9zE3V4kVsJtecSsgDkT1rw3F.png" } ]

A successful post to the API will return the HTTP status code 202, i.e. "Accepted", because the request is received for processing but is currently pending, i.e. nothing has been downloaded from S3 or sent to Xact yet.

Once a request has been accepted then it will be processed as follows:

  1. the attachment keys will be verified in S3 and any invalid/non-existent attachments will be discarded (and logged as failed);
  2. using the content-lengths reported by S3 for each file, the files will be grouped (using a first-fit-descending bin-packing algorithm!) so no single group exceeds 20MB (that's a configurable threshold);
  3. each attachment group will be sent via a separate POST request to Xact;
  4. when all of the attachment groups have been sent to Xact (or failed to be sent) a JSON response is available that details the success/fail status of every attachment.

The final result that is available to be posted back to an OnDemand API has this format (note the "success" true/false property for each attachment):

{ "transactionId": "03YRN18", "attachments": [ { "id": 1234, "key": "6/photos/ycnYxyd7q5BVcXIfBDLMdAjAQNihjUpj36yCUSvC.jpeg", "filename": "house.png", "description": "testing", "datetime": "2020-03-18T18:25:31Z", "contentLength": 7548445, "success": true }, { "id": 2345, "key": "6/photos/0nJERpPiCSEmw1MUuCQ48WiKOSHl32PAbPplEjqh.jpeg", "filename": "flashing.jpeg", "datetime": "2020-03-18T16:23:52Z", "contentLength": 7476024, "success": true }, { "id": 2, "key": "6/photos/invalid.jpeg", "datetime": "2020-03-18T16:23:52Z", "success": false } ] }

@Kris Anolfo do you also want to remove the GRS Application Received field as well?

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1581969021063,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-3","author":"Kanolfo","authorFullName":"Kris Anolfo","issueId":"BS-14","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Garth Murray I believe GRS Application Received needs to stay as that date is used to track when an adjuster needs to renew their 1099 application. However I reached out to Linda to confirm and will circle back around when she responds. The field GRS Application Requested is from an old workflow and does not apply anymore so it can be removed.

","shownForIssueAuthor":false,"created":1581969925573,"updated":0,"permittedGroup":null,"markdown":true,"replies":[]},{"id":"4-4","author":"Kanolfo","authorFullName":"Kris Anolfo","issueId":"BS-14","parentId":null,"deleted":false,"jiraId":null,"text":"

@Garth Murray Linda confirmed that both fields can be removed. It's not super important to capture when we received someone's application, just that we have one. We upload a copy of the application itself to the adjuster's profile which captures the date, so we will have that information available to us if it's needed for some reason.
